summary: This bill, the Dyess Air Base Access Infrastructure Design Act, mandates the Secretary of the Air Force to undertake planning and design activities for infrastructure improvements at Dyess Air Force Base in Texas. Specifically, it focuses on the Tye Gate and Arnold Gate projects, outlining maximum project amounts ($17 million for Tye Gate, $12,065,000 for Arnold Gate) and specific design considerations for each gate. The bill specifies the use of existing funds allocated for planning and design within military construction accounts.
